image.altText: outside of a courthouse in the sun

items.synopsis: The mother is facing two charges in the Darwin Local Court after allegedly abducted her daughter and son from the custody of their father and legal guardian on a supervised parental visit.

title.children: Mother charged with abducting her children loses appeal to have case thrown out

image.altText: Aging electricity infrastructure in the Northern Territory

items.synopsis: An NT Utilities Commission report has found the territory's government has been slow to deal with increasing rooftop solar and the scheduled retirement of gas generators, risking a secure Darwin-Katherine power system.

title.children: Top End at risk of power blackouts within three years

image.altText: A woman wearing a camel jacket and black top leans on a fence surrounded by white roses.

items.synopsis: Jacqueline Bradley has worked all her life but found herself unemployed at 61. She's applied for dozens of suitable jobs but says the constant rejection makes it difficult to keep going.

title.children: At 61, Jacqueline can't find work. She doesn't eat until midday

image.altText: A black and white image of an older man with white hair holding a cigarette in his artist studio

items.synopsis: Post MeToo, audiences are reconsidering great artistic works in the light of their creators' transgressions. But is it truly possible to separate the art from the artist?

title.children: Picasso and Polanski committed horrific acts. What do we do with their art?

image.altText: a young aboriginal man working behind a bar

items.synopsis: Patrons entering Beswick's licensed social club must follow a strict set of rules or risk getting kicked out. It's all in a bid to encourage safe drinking habits in community.

title.children: How one remote NT social club is working to reduce alcohol-related harm

image.altText: woman taking a selfie in a car

items.synopsis: Ahmad Hodroj is accused of murdering his estranged wife Amira Moughnieh after she died at a home in Sydney's south last night.

title.children: 'Loved life': Sydney mother of three allegedly murdered by estranged husband

image.altText: Paul Smith in his 20s on a motorbike

items.synopsis: Lightning strikes in a split second. Those who survive being struck can be left with lifelong consequences, including cognitive disability, relationship breakdowns and a dark shadow over their mental health.

title.children: Paul was struck by lightning in his 20s. He was never the same again

image.altText: Green background and yellow text that reads The Nationals for Regional NSW.

items.synopsis: The NSW Nationals asked for and received $20,000 from its youth wing to spend on negative campaign ads in target seats in the recent 2023 state election, according to internal party documents.

title.children: Young Nats tapped for negative ad war chest in state election campaign

image.altText: A PHEV on display at a Shanghai auto exhibition in 2023

items.synopsis: The latest sales figures suggest the age of the plug-in hybrid electric vehicle that can charge from a power point and fill up at the service station appears to be drawing to an end, at least in Australia.

title.children: Plug-in hybrids are being left in the dust as battery EV sales surge ahead

image.altText: An Indigenous woman with dark red hair looking down as she speaks with a dark background

items.synopsis: The Arrernte elder, artist and author was a recipient of an Order of Australia Medal in 1997 for her work in the First Nations community in Central Australia.

title.children: Indigenous elder Dr MK Turner OAM remembered as 'jewel of Alice Springs' after passing

image.altText: A protester is challenged by security on tennis court.

items.synopsis: Australia's Daria Saville sees her Wimbledon first-round match interrupted by protesters who invade Court 18 before being arrested by London police, with the UK home secretary promising harsh punishments.

title.children: Dark day for Australians as climate protesters arrested at Wimbledon

image.altText: A woolly Merino ram with horns.

items.synopsis: The luxury fibre has fallen out of favour amid a global slowdown, with some producers choosing to dump lower-grade fleece instead of paying to store it.

title.children: Wool dumped in landfill as cost of living drives demand and price down

image.altText: A dog with his tongue hanging out, lying on a lawn.

items.synopsis: A Gold Coast dad says his sons are beside themselves as a result of the "disgusting" crime. The family's car was also stolen and their house was trashed.

title.children: Heartless thieves steal blind dog, shove baby photos into toilet during daylight robbery

image.altText: A woman wearing a black and green jumper and glasses with her young daughter peering over her right shoulder by a window.

items.synopsis: Data from CoreLogic shows rental prices have continued to climb as the market battles chronic housing shortages and rising demand for housing. But despite an increase in the rental vacancy rate, rents are expected to keep rising.

title.children: 'I don't go to the doctor anymore': Angela rents in the most affordable capital city, but one more increase will make her homeless

image.altText: Dust rising off a mine site with green hills in the foreground and background.

items.synopsis: Cadia Valley Operations says the NSW mine has breached clean air rules but maintains public health is not at risk.

title.children: Australia's largest gold mine admits to dust pollution as neighbours fear health impacts

image.altText: A family poses for a photograph.

items.synopsis: Australia sees skilled migrants as a critical part to filling a jobs shortage but those already here are telling friends not to follow.

title.children: Skilled migrants say 50-year parent visa delays make Australia less attractive

image.altText: Rocket launches on pad, beside two towers

items.synopsis: The Ariane 5 launcher embarks on its 117th and final mission, leaving Europe without a functioning space launch capacity for the first time since 1979.

title.children: Europe without dedicated space launcher after rocket takes off for the last time

image.altText: A soldier in protective camouflage gear ducks and holds his helmet as a mortar explodes into the sky behind him

items.synopsis: The counteroffensive is making steady gains, but Ukraine isn't taking any chances. While soldiers grind on in bloody battle, everyday civilians are preparing to defend their villages from a potential Russian advance.

title.children: While Putin was mired in personal drama, Ukraine was quietly carrying out its counteroffensive

image.altText: A Chinese woman with long hair smiling and gesturing in geometric black and silver dress on red carpet.

items.synopsis: The Hong Kong-born star had been suffering from depression for several years, her sisters said, with her condition deteriorating drastically over the last few months.

title.children: Pop singer CoCo Lee, who voiced Disney's Mulan, dies at 48

image.altText: Man's hands holds a handful of rusted metal coins, bracelets, watch, ring, under a blue sky, green trees, beach in distance.

items.synopsis: Memphis, who lives with autism, gets upset when other kids "see that he is different". Now his dad, Jason Marshall, has introduced him to a new pastime, "popular in Europe".

title.children: What is magnet fishing? Treasure hunters say it's an activity that's taking off especially for kids

image.altText: A man wearing a hat and singlet sits in a car taking a selfie on his phone

items.synopsis: A man facing 18 domestic violence charges after his former partner was found dead is granted bail as "the elephant in the room" of a potential murder charge is yet to be determined, a court hears.

title.children: 'The elephant in the room': Sydney man facing 18 DV charges after death of ex-partner granted bail

image.altText: An aerial  shot of a black hearse surrounded by more than a dozen WA Police motorbikes on a road in Perth.

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says the nation will mourn with the family and friends of WA Police Constable Anthony Woods, who was killed in the line of duty.

title.children: Police escort for fallen constable's final journey as hundreds attend funeral to farewell WA officer

image.altText: Squigly lines of black and rainbow colours with the words say more and Threads

items.synopsis: Twitter's Elon Musk ridicules new app Threads created by Instagram to crush his problem-riddled platform. What is it and what could it mean for social media if it succeeds?

title.children: Musk hits back at new app Threads, says it is better to be attacked on Twitter

image.altText: Smoke coming from a building

items.synopsis: Emergency services say 18 people were assessed by paramedics after a fire broke out at the detention centre in Sydney's west this morning.

title.children: Detainees jump from windows as fire breaks out at Sydney's Villawood Detention Centre

image.altText: The windscreen and driver's side of a white van, parked at an angle.

items.synopsis: Energy Safe Victoria warns about the dangers of gas appliances in small spaces after the woman was found dead inside an unventilated campervan with a gas-powered fridge operating beside her in Cohuna last year.

title.children: Coroner confirms 88yo woman died from carbon monoxide poisoning in campervan

image.altText: Fans take their seat at the SCG amid overcast conditions

items.synopsis: Fresh criticism has surfaced about major Australian stadiums' use of facial recognition for ticket-holders to some of the country's biggest events.

title.children: How a trip to the footy could end up with you being 'treated like a criminal'

image.altText: AFL logo

items.synopsis: The AFL is investigating the illegal distribution of explicit images of AFL players that have been shared online without their consent.

title.children: 'Appalling and disgusting act': AFLPA hits out at distribution of explicit player images

image.altText: The crowd cheers on a hill by the side of the road as an Australian cyclist raises his arms riding over the line to win a stage.

items.synopsis: Jai Hindley did his homework ahead of the Tour de France, and it pays off with an opportunistic breakaway on day one in the Pyrenees — now the Perth rider is living his cycling dream with his parents there to witness it, writes Sophie Smith.

title.children: 'Living like a monk' pays off for Aussie Jai Hindley, as his perfect Tour prep is capped by mountain breakaway

image.altText: A man in a blue suit walks hand in hand with a woman in a wedding dress whose face has been blurred for privacy.

items.synopsis: Police say they have charged a 36-year-old man known to the father found dead in his Gold Coast hinterland home last week.

title.children: 'They were friends': Gold Coast police charge man with alleged murder of Tamborine Mountain father

image.altText: A composite picture of two women sitting with contemplative expressions.

items.synopsis: A Noongar elder and advocates from both sides of the Indigenous Voice to Parliament debate fear many Australians will vote in the looming referendum without knowing what they are voting for.

title.children: These advocates are voting differently on the Voice — they want you to know why
